comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Talma and Co.[photographer] was a commercial photographic company active in Australia. The firm had studios in Melbourne (119 Swanston St.), and Sydney (374 George Street). [1]  They were renowned for their theatrical photography.

comment.author: 47214674@N03
comment._content: I have heard of her before, I think there has been a movie made about her, not sure.  She was really famous back then.

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content:
Dear dblackmore,

We don't know much about Ada Ferrar. Her career was mainly in Shakespeare on the stage. Much more famous was Geraldine Farrar, one of the world's leading sopranos early in the 20th century who often sang with Caruso at the Metropolitan Opera in New York and who made many silent films (1915-1920). Later she appeared on television and  in a few sound films.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Oh fame ... it is so fleeting ;-) There are some who might say that Ada's sister, Beatrice Ferrar, was more famous than Ada ... both were English born actresses; both studied under Sir Frank Benson, and both starred in London and on Broadway. Ada toured throughout Australia for several years starring in a repertory company with Julius Knight. [1] "Miss Beatrice Ferrar as 'Puck'" by Ellis and Walery
